Reviews.Title: “nice location and great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Murat_Demirci
Reviews.Content: It's has a great location at heart of old Istanbul.Walking distance to all tourist spots and transportation.The breakfast served at the terrace which has a awsome view.The room was smelling really fresh and I asked to the guy at the reception and he told me that they reconditioned the hotel from all the begining just couple months ago.The staff was really kind and helpful.Looking forward to visit agin.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, very good location”
Reviews.Author: anmarcorfu
Reviews.Content: New hotel,clean and stylish rooms not so big,but when you go to istanbul you want a place to rest for few hours and not to stay in the hotel. The location is perfect 50 m. from tram and 200 m.from grand baazar. 10 minutes walk from Ayia Sofia Blue mosque and Top capi. Very quite smole street, Friendly staf (Metin is nice man) good breacfast. The only minor is that, the coridor some times noisy at the afternoon if you want to have a siesta. I found the prices at 65 euros i think its a good price. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mido2003
Reviews.Content: The is my second time in this hotel .i' ve stayed three days from 24/11/2011 to 27/11 very good location in sultan Ahmet area.very close to the bayazit tram station.also to the old souq(old market) and to the most tourist and historic sites.easy to reach from the aeroport via tramway.the only bed think in this hotel is the breakfast and the size of the room if u have extra luggage then this is not your choice.Also the service is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “we're looking for next meeting”
Reviews.Author: lovelynyx
Reviews.Content: we had no idea about this otel at first but after our stay we can't say anything bad about this otel. Staffs are very kind and smoothie. The Otel has clean rooms, perfect breakfast in a good restaurant at terrace and a wonderful sea view of Istanbul. Also otel is closer to the historical places such as Sultan Ahmet, Grand Bazaar, St. Sophia.
